comments:
Build 20020125 stable Win NT 4 SP 6 
After receiving an out of memory error while trying to process an event in the 
Workspace event loop. Eclipse began generating numerous Internal Error message 
dialogs (Didn't count them all but was well over 100.)  It appears as though 
when the initial error occurs an error dialog is trying to be displayed.  This 
causes an exception in the Window event loop.  This exception in turn attempts 
to display an Internal error dialog which causes an exception which tries to 
display an Internal error dialog which causes an exception and so on, and so 
on, and so on.  Here is an excerpt from the log showing the events.  I haven't 
included the entire log as it is over 4MB in size.  I have seen similar 
behavior exhibited (repeating Internal Error dialogs) in other situations.

Log: Wed Jan 30 12:44:49 CST 2002
1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
Log: Wed Jan 30 12:44:49 CST 2002
4 org.eclipse.ui 0 Failed to execute runnable (java.lang.OutOfMemoryError)

Tested in 20020501 by importing all of Eclipse into a workbench as described in 
Bug 14802 and only one dialog is shown.
